Package org.webpki.xml

Class XMLObjectWrapper

java.lang.Object
org.webpki.xml.XMLObjectWrapper
Direct Known Subclasses:
XMLSignatureWrapper
public abstract class XMLObjectWrapper
extends Object
Base class for java classes whos data can be translated to/from XML documents.

A XMLObjectWrapper subclass represents (and handles) a certain schema.

A XMLObjectWrapper subclass should be capable of initializing from a DOM Document and also produce a DOM Document representing it's current state. It must have a public empty (no argument-) constructor to allow the XMLSchemaCache to create an object instance and call it's namespace and element methods.

A short example of an XMLObjectWrapper using DOMReaderHelper and DOMWriterHelper to handle it's XML representation is supplied with the distribution.

      Throws:
      IOException - If something unexpected happens...

    • wrap

      protected XMLObjectWrapper wrap​(Element e) throws IOException
      Wrap an element using the XMLSchemaCache that created this wrapper instance.

      The wrapper class to be used is determined using XMLSchemaCache's wrap(Element) method, which has a known weakness, described in it's documentation, that should be considered when using this method.

      Parameters:
      e - Element
      Returns:
      Wrapper
      Throws:
      IOException - If something unexpected happens...
      IllegalStateException - If this wrapper object was not created by an XMLSchemaCache.

    • toXML

      protected abstract void toXML​(DOMWriterHelper helper) throws IOException
      Get the XML-encoding of the object.

      This method should only produce an Element, it should not be inserted into the document (as this method will not know where in the tree the caller intends to put the element). The document is passed as an argument only because it is needed to produce nodes. The caller is responsible for inserting the element into the tree.

      Parameters:
      helper - Helper
      Throws:
      IOException - If something unexpected happens...
